titleStmt.title: John M. Palmer to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1645

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
Head-Quarters Department of Kentucky,
Louisville, Ky., Sept. 4, 1865.
His Excellency,
Thomas E. Bramlette,
Governor of Kentucky.
Sir:-
Your letter of August 28th has been received, and in reply, I have the honor to state that no arrests have ever been made on the representation of Captain J. C. Olin,
Should any arrests be ordered for political offenses, I will apprise you unless they demand immediate disposition.

I have the honor to be
Very Respectfully,
John M Palmer
Major General.
